alert.note: Alert for Labette (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued March 31 at 3:22PM CDT until March 31 at 4:45PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wichita has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... North central Labette County in southeastern Kansas... * Until 445 PM CDT. * At 319 PM CDT, a dust channel was near Altamont, and contiously affecting US-59. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with damaging wind in excess of 70 mph. SOURCE...Law enforcement report numerous accidents along US-59 from Parsons to Altamont. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * Locations impacted include... Parsons and Altamont. US-59 has been closed from Parsons to Altamont due to near zero visibility. Avoid this area! PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE! There is no safe place on a highway when a dust storm hits. Visibility can be lost immediately, making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped vehicles. Delay travel, or safely exit the highway before the dust storm arrives.
